SUMMARY: YafQ-DinJ toxin-antitoxin system was identified by its similarity to RelE-RelB toxin-antitoxin system [9767574]. Expression of YafQ alone reduces protein synsis and inhibits growth, and coexpression of DinJ alleviates that phenotype, acting as antitoxin [17263853, 17367382, 19210620]. YafQ and DinJ form a stable complex [17263853] which can bind to dinJ-yafQ palindrome upstream of translation start site [19210620]. A strain from which all five toxin-antitoxin systems have been deleted shows no deficiency in its stress response or competitiveness under nutrient-limited conditions [17513477]. However, biofilm formation is affected via expression of TabA protein [19060153]. A dinJ-yafQ deletion mutant is impaired in biofilm formation [19707553]. Deletion of any single toxin-antitoxin system encoding an RNase has no effect on persister formation, but deleting ten such systems dramatically reduces persister formation. Persister formation depends on degradation of antitoxins by Lon protease [21788497]. A crystal structure of DinJ-YafQ complex has been resolved at 1.8 Ã… [24898247].
